GAJARIA , Bangladesh - Anguished relatives protested a decision Saturday , May 17 , to stop searching for bodies of passengers they feared were trapped inside a ferry that sunk in central Bangladesh leaving at least 54 dead , police said .

Two salvage vessels managed to float the sunken ship , MV Miraz , and brought it closer to the shore , allowing divers to search inside of the 90 - feet ( 30 meter ) - long boat 3 days after it sank .

RelatedSentence: The search for bodies in the Meghna river , one of the world 's widest , would continue as authorities feared that some could have been washed downstream by strong currents .
